update.description:
This requires:

* #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-fuel-tools/pull-requests/82
* #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/180
* #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/127

Once this is ready, you'll be able to specify world files with:

```
    <include>
      <uri>https://fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/1.0/nate/models/my_Backpack</uri>
    </include> 
```

Try out:

```
ign-gazebo -f examples/worlds/empty.world
```

![fuel-tools.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/4154114752-fuel-tools.png)
update.title: [A-1] Fuel tools

content.raw: Do we want to check that the file is created? There are example tests on `ign-fuel-tools` which use `ign-common`'s filesystem.
content.html: Do we want to check that the file is created? There are example tests on ign-fuel-tools which use ign-common's filesystem.

content.raw:
There are some hardcoded URIs in this model, i.e.:

`<uri>file:///home/developer/.ignition/fuel/fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/nate/models/my_x2_description/1//meshes/x2_chassis.dae</uri>`

Also, it has some nested models which we [don't support yet](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/issues/10/nested-model-support). So I see these errors printed:

~~~
[Err] [SDFFeatures.cc:601] Asked to create a joint from link [//base_link] to link [left_headlight::body] in the model [x2], but the child link could not be found in that model!
[Err] [SDFFeatures.cc:601] Asked to create a joint from link [//base_link] to link [right_headlight::body] in the model [x2], but the child link could not be found in that model!
[Err] [SDFFeatures.cc:601] Asked to create a joint from link [//base_link] to link [center_left_headlight::body] in the model [x2], but the child link could not be found in that model!
[Err] [SDFFeatures.cc:601] Asked to create a joint from link [//base_link] to link [center_right_headlight::body] in the model [x2], but the child link could not be found in that model!
[Err] [SDFFeatures.cc:601] Asked to create a joint from link [//base_link] to link [rear_center_led::body] in the model [x2], but the child link could not be found in that model!
[Err] [SDFFeatures.cc:601] Asked to create a joint from link [//base_link] to link [right_lateral_led::body] in the model [x2], but the child link could not be found in that model!
[Err] [SDFFeatures.cc:601] Asked to create a joint from link [//base_link] to link [left_lateral_led::body] in the model [x2], but the child link could not be found in that model!
~~~
content.html:
There are some hardcoded URIs in this model, i.e.:

<uri>file:///home/developer/.ignition/fuel/fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/nate/models/my_x2_description/1//meshes/x2_chassis.dae</uri>

Also, it has some nested models which we don't support yet. So I see these errors printed:

[Err] [SDFFeatures.cc:601] Asked to create a joint from link [//base_link] to link [left_headlight::body] in the model [x2], but the child link could not be found in that model!
[Err] [SDFFeatures.cc:601] Asked to create a joint from link [//base_link] to link [right_headlight::body] in the model [x2], but the child link could not be found in that model!
[Err] [SDFFeatures.cc:601] Asked to create a joint from link [//base_link] to link [center_left_headlight::body] in the model [x2], but the child link could not be found in that model!
[Err] [SDFFeatures.cc:601] Asked to create a joint from link [//base_link] to link [center_right_headlight::body] in the model [x2], but the child link could not be found in that model!
[Err] [SDFFeatures.cc:601] Asked to create a joint from link [//base_link] to link [rear_center_led::body] in the model [x2], but the child link could not be found in that model!
[Err] [SDFFeatures.cc:601] Asked to create a joint from link [//base_link] to link [right_lateral_led::body] in the model [x2], but the child link could not be found in that model!
[Err] [SDFFeatures.cc:601] Asked to create a joint from link [//base_link] to link [left_lateral_led::body] in the model [x2], but the child link could not be found in that model!

content.raw: No model is guaranteed, including models by openrobotics. We also can't upload new models from openrobotics right now.

content.raw: Are these models guaranteed to stay up for long? Should we use examples from the `openrobotics` account?
content.html: Are these models guaranteed to stay up for long? Should we use examples from the openrobotics account?

content.raw: The world is not really empty, consider renaming it to something like `fuel.sdf`
content.html: The world is not really empty, consider renaming it to something like fuel.sdf
